titleStmt.title: TEI transcription for Letting the Cat out of the Bag!!

For inquiries about commercial uses, please contact the Historical Society of Pennsylvania. HSP retains the rights of all images unless otherwise noted. Possession of an HSP digital image does not constitute permission to use or publish it. msIdentifier.collection: Historical Society of Pennsylvania cartoons and caricatures collection

history.acquisition: This is an artificial collection created over time by HSP staff mostly through donations and purchases of individual prints. It also incorporates previously uncataloged materials collected by the Balch Institute for Ethnic Studies. Some of the 20th century cartoons and drawings were removed from the J. Hampton Moore papers (Collection 1541).

monogr.title: Letting the Cat out of the Bag!!

projectDesc.p: The Historic Images, New Technologies (HINT) project aims to enhance description and discovery of the Historical Society of Pennsylvania's graphics materials and promote the linking and sharing of content among institutions and scholars. The project will result in an update to HSP's digital image viewer and an online digital history exhibit that will demonstrate the new viewer's capabilities and provide interpretive and contextual materials to encourage users to interact with historical images in new ways. This project was funded by a grant from the National Historical Publications and Records Commission's (NHPRC) Innovation in Archives and Documentary Editing program

editorialDecl.p: This electronic file was created using manual keying following the recommendations for Level 4 of "Best Practices for TEI in Libraries" guidelines v3.0.
This XML file uses unique entity identifiers, media file identifiers, and collection identifiers in HSP's Digital Library, available at http://digitallibrary.hsp.org

revisionDesc.change: Completed full encoding to basic level, referencing DAMS media and entity codes
Updated entity codes and media code to match test DAMS system.
Changed people/org references to use entity codes only, and switched attributes for those references to @key instead of @ref.
Added more corrections for canonical TEI plans.
Updated file to match canonical TEI plans.
Additional sample encoding added for import testing

div.p: Radical antislavery senator Charles Sumner releases a snarling cat, labeled "Spirit of Discord," from the "Republican Bag." Horace Greeley, Abraham Lincoln, Henry J. Raymond, and William H. Seward, worried that perceived Republican opposition to slavery will doom Lincoln's hopes for the presidential election of 1860, express alarm.

div.head: LETTING THE CAT OUT OF THE BAG!!
div.p: by Currier & Ives, in the Clerk's Office of the of N.Y.
What are you doing Sumner! you'll spoil all! she aint to be let out until after Lincoln is elected,_
Oh Sumner! this is too bad!_ I thought we had her safely bagged at Chicago, now there will be the old scratch to pay, unless I can drive her back again with my rail!_
Scat!_ s'cat!- back with her, or our fat will all be in the fire._
It's no use talking Gentlemen, I was'nt mentioned at Chicago, and now I'm going to do something desperate, I can't afford to have my head broken and be kept corked up four years for nothing! _
Gentlemen be cautious, you dont know how to manage that animal as well as I did, and I'm afraid that some of you will get scratched
